We operate sectors oil natural gas service industry: Rental Services; International Drilling; Directional Drilling; Tubular Services; Underbalanced Drilling Production Services. Our central operating strategy provide high-quality, technologically advanced services equipment. As result commitment customer service, developed strong relationships leading oil natural gas companies, including independents majors. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> Our growth strategy focused identifying pursuing opportunities markets growing faster oilfield services industry capitalize competitive strengths. Our organic growth primarily achieved expanding geographic scope, acquiring complementary property equipment, hiring personnel service regions cross-selling products services. As February&#160;29, 2008, rig fleet actively marketed, drilling rig presently inactive require approximately $6.4&#160;million capital expenditures operational. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <I>Directional Drilling.</I>&#160;&#160;We utilize state-of-the-art equipment provide planning engineering services, directional drilling packages, downhole motor technology, site directional supervision, exploratory development re-entry drilling, downhole guidance services drilling services customers. We provide logging-while-drilling measurement-while-drilling (MWD) services. In 2007, expanded capability completing acquisitions approximately $37.3&#160;million total. These Coker (June 2007), Diggar (July 2007)&#160;and Diamondback (November 2007). These acquisitions provided additional directional drillers, downhole motors, MWD tools enabled expand presence Northern Rockies Mid-Continent areas. We team approximately 105&#160;full-time directional drillers maintain inventory approximately 300 drilling motors. Our straight-hole motors offer opportunity capture additional market share. We operate sectors oil natural gas service industry: Rental Services; International Drilling; Directional Drilling; Tubular Services; Underbalanced Drilling Production Services. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> We derive operating revenues rates job charge labor equipment required provide service rates day equipment tools rent customers. This statement requires share-based payments employees, including grants employee stock options, recognized financial statements based grant-date fair values. We adopted SFAS&#160;No.&#160;123R modified prospective transition method, utilizing Black-Scholes option pricing model calculation fair employee stock options. Under modified prospective method, record compensation cost related unvested stock awards December&#160;31, 2005 recognizing unamortized grant date fair awards remaining vesting periods awards change historical reported earnings. Therefore, recorded expense $3.4&#160;million related stock awards year ended December&#160;31, 2006 $3.0&#160;million recorded general administrative expense balance recorded direct cost. Prior January&#160;1, 2006, accounted stock-based compensation Accounting Principle Board Opinion No.&#160;25, APB No.&#160;25. Under APB No.&#160;25, compensation expense recognized stock options exercise price market price grant date option. Accordingly, compensation cost recognized APB No.&#160;25. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> Amortization expense $1.9&#160;million year ended December&#160;31, 2006 compared $1.5&#160;million year ended December&#160;31, 2005. Provisions doubtful accounts recorded evident customers make required payments contractual due dates future. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <I>Revenue Recognition.</I>&#160;&#160;We provide rental equipment drilling services customers day, daywork, job contractual rates recognize drilling related revenue work progresses collectibility assured. Revenue daywork contracts recognized realized realizable earned. On daywork contracts, revenue recognized based number days completed fixed rates stipulated contract. For contracts, receive lump-sum fees equipment mobilization costs. Mobilization fees related costs deferred amortized contract terms material. The Securities Exchange Commission&#146;s Staff Accounting Bulletin&#160;No.&#160;104, <I>Revenue Recognition Financial Statements</I>, guidance SEC staff&#146;s views application generally accepted accounting principles selected revenue recognition issues. Our revenue recognition policy accordance generally accepted accounting principles SAB&#160;No.&#160;104. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <I>Impairment Of Long-Lived Assets.</I>&#160;&#160;Long-lived assets, include property, plant equipment, goodwill intangibles, comprise significant amount total assets. We make judgments estimates conjunction carrying assets, including amounts capitalized, depreciation amortization methods lives. Additionally, carrying values assets reviewed impairment events circumstances carrying amounts recoverable. An impairment loss recorded period determined carrying amount recoverable. This requires make long-term forecasts future revenues costs related assets subject review. These forecasts require assumptions demand products services, future market conditions technological developments. Significant unanticipated assumptions require provision impairment future period. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <I>Goodwill And Other Intangibles.</I>&#160;&#160;As December&#160;31, 2007, recorded approximately $138.4&#160;million goodwill $35.2&#160;million identifiable intangible assets. We perform purchase price allocations intangible assets make business combination. Business combinations purchase price allocations consummated acquisitions reportable segments. The excess purchase price allocation fair values tangible assets allocated identifiable intangibles goodwill. Subsequently, perform initial impairment tests annual impairment tests accordance Financial Accounting Standards Board No.&#160;141, <I>Business Combinations</I>, Financial Accounting Standards Board No.&#160;142, <I>Goodwill Other Intangible Assets. </I>These initial valuations approaches determine carrying amount individual reporting units. The approach Discounted Cash Flow Method, focuses expected cash flow. In applying approach, cash flow distribution projected finite period years. Cash flow distribution defined amount cash distributed dividend impairing future profitability operations. The cash flow distribution terminal (our end estimation period) discounted present derive indication business enterprise. This valuation method dependent assumptions made future cash flow cash requirements. The approach Guideline Company Method focuses comparing selected similar publicly traded companies. Under method, valuation multiples are: (i)&#160;derived operating data selected similar companies; (ii)&#160;evaluated adjusted based strengths weaknesses relative selected guideline companies; (iii)&#160;applied operating data arrive indication value. This valuation method dependent assumption evaluated analysis earnings strengths weaknesses relative selected similar companies. Significant unanticipated assumptions require provision impairment future period. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <I>Income Taxes.</I>&#160;&#160;The determination evaluation annual income tax provision involves interpretation tax laws jurisdictions operate requires significant judgment estimates assumptions significant future events amount, timing character income, deductions tax credits. Changes tax laws, regulations level operations profitability jurisdiction impact tax liability year. While annual tax provision based information time, number years elapse </DIV> <P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <BR> 46 </DIV><!-- END WIDTH --> <!-- PAGEBREAK --> <P><HR noshade><P> <H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table Contents</A></H5><P> <DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN WIDTH --> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> ultimate tax liabilities tax jurisdictions determined. equity cash flows years period ended December&#160;31, 2007. </FONT></B> </TD> <TD> <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NATURE BUSINESS SUMMARY SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES</FONT></B> </TD> </TR> </TABLE> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> Allis-Chalmers Energy Inc. (&#147;Allis-Chalmers&#148;, &#147;we&#148;, &#147;our&#148; &#147;us&#148;) incorporated Delaware 1913. We provide services equipment oil natural gas exploration production companies United States including Texas, Louisiana, New Mexico, Colorado, Oklahoma, Mississippi, Wyoming, Arkansas, West Virginia, offshore Gulf Mexico, internationally, primarily Argentina Mexico. We operate sectors oil natural gas service industry: Rental Services; International Drilling; Directional Drilling; Tubular Services; Underbalanced Drilling Production Services. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> The nature operations regions operate subject changing economic, regulatory political conditions. We vulnerable near-term long-term demand prices oil natural gas related demand oilfield service operations. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Use Estimates</FONT></I></B> </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> The preparation financial statements conformity accounting principles generally accepted United States America requires management make estimates assumptions affect reported amounts assets liabilities disclosure contingent assets liabilities date financial statements, reported amounts revenues expenses reporting period. Future events effects perceived certainty. Accordingly, accounting estimates require exercise judgment. While management believes estimates assumptions preparation consolidated financial statements appropriate, actual results differ estimates. Estimates for, limited to, determining following: allowance doubtful accounts, recoverability long-lived assets intangibles, lives depreciation amortization, income taxes valuation allowances. The accounting estimates preparation consolidated financial statements change events occur, experience acquired, additional information obtained operating environment changes. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Principles Consolidation</FONT></I></B> </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> The consolidated financial statements include accounts Allis-Chalmers subsidiaries. Our subsidiaries December&#160;31, 2007 AirComp LLC (&#147;AirComp&#148;), Allis-Chalmers Tubular Services LLC (&#147;Tubular&#148;), Strata Directional Technology LLC (&#147;Strata&#148;), Allis-Chalmers Rental Services LLC (&#147;Rental&#148;), Allis-Chalmers Production Services LLC (&#147;Production&#148;), Allis-Chalmers Management LLC, Allis-Chalmers Holdings Inc., DLS Drilling, Logistics&#160;&#038; Services Corporation (&#147;DLS&#148;), DLS Argentina Limited, Tanus Argentina S.A. (&#147;Tanus&#148;), Petro-Rentals LLC (&#147;Petro-Rental&#148;) Rebel Rentals LLC (&#147;Rebel&#148;). All significant inter-company transactions eliminated. </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Revenue Recognition</FONT></I></B> </DIV> <DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF"> We provide rental equipment drilling services customers day, daywork, job contractual rates recognize drilling related revenue work progresses collectibility assured. Revenue daywork contracts recognized realized realizable earned. On daywork contracts, revenue recognized based number days completed fixed rates stipulated contract. Basic earnings share computed basis weighted average number shares common stock outstanding period. Diluted earnings share similar basic earnings share, presents dilutive effect share basis potential common shares (e.g., convertible preferred stock, stock options, etc.) converted. Restricted stock grants legally considered issued outstanding, included basic diluted earnings share extent vested. Unvested restricted stock included computation diluted earnings share treasury stock method. The merger agreement, approved Board Directors Board Directors Bronco, Bronco stockholders receive aggregate merger consideration approximately $437.8&#160;million, consisting (a)&#160;$280.0&#160;million cash (b)&#160;shares common stock, par $0.01 share, aggregate approximately $157.8&#160;million.
